intro: Claytonia erythrocoma, commonly known as the red-topped springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, oval leaves. The plant produces small, pink to red flowers with five petals, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
